Information Bulletin Issued in Denmark 
   Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- The Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association issued an information bulletin on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
 The bulletin carried an article praising the greatness and the undying revolutionary exploits of President Kim Il Sung contributed by the chairman of the association, news that the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il was observed with splendor in various parts of the world this year and an article introducing the functions held in celebration of the 60th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people in their drive to build a great prosperous powerful socialist nation. .   
 It informed the readers of the Korean people's struggle to implement the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration, the cooperation and exchange between the north and the south and the activities of the association for supporting the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea.

articles.content:
Staff Members of Vietnamese Embassy Help Korean Farmers 
   Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- Vietnamese Ambassador to the DPRK Phan Trong Thai and staff members of the Vietnamese embassy here Tuesday went to the DPRK-Vietnam Friendship Jamjin Co-op Farm to help it in its farm work. 
 They gave helping hands to the farmers in transplanting humus-cake maize seedlings. During break they sang songs and conversed with them, deepening the friendship. .   
 They handed aid materials to the farm that day.

Chinese Delegation Here 
   Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Xinhua News Agency of China led by Deputy Editor-in-Chief Ju Mengjun arrived here Wednesday.
 It was met at the airport by Kim Chang Gwang, deputy director general of the Korean Central News Agency, and the minister councilor of the Chinese embassy here.

E-Library of Kim Chaek University of Technology Visited by Foreign Diplomats 
   Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- Officials in charge of cultural and friendly relations of different embassies here visited the E-Library of Kim Chaek University of Technology Wednesday.
 They went round with keen interest book lending and reading rooms of the IT based E-Library. .   
 At the end of the visit, they made entries in the visitor's book.
